notes: Fifth generation on PQ35 platform. Multiple engine options from 2.5L I5 to turbo 2.0T. TDI diesel available. FWD only. Manual, automatic or DSG transmission. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Jetta article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth generation on PQ34 platform. Multiple engine options from base 2.0L to VR6. TDI diesel popular option. FWD only. Available as sedan or wagon. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Jetta article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth generation Passat (B6) on PQ46 platform. 2.0T turbo four-cylinder, 3.6L VR6, or 2.0L TDI diesel. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Available as sedan or wagon. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Passat article, January 2025 revision.

Passat B5.5 facelift. Multiple engine options including rare W8. TDI diesel available. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Available as sedan or wagon. TDI and W8 require specialized service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Passat article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth generation Golf on PQ34 platform. Base 2.0L I4, 1.8T turbo, or 1.9L TDI diesel. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Available as 2-door or 4-door. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth generation Golf on PQ35 platform. 2.5L inline-five engine. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Available as 2-door or 4-door. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Golf Mk5 sold as Rabbit in North America (2006-2009). 2.5L inline-five engine. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Available as 2-door or 4-door. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth generation performance hatchback. 1.8T turbo four-cylinder with 180 hp. FWD. Manual transmission only. Available as 2-door or 4-door. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth generation performance hatchback on PQ35 platform. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder with 200 hp. FWD. Manual or DSG dual-clutch transmission. Available as 2-door or 4-door. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

High-performance Golf R32 with 3.2L VR6 engine. Standard 4Motion AWD. Manual or DSG dual-clutch transmission. Mk4 R32 sold 2004, Mk5 R32 sold 2008. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Modern reinterpretation of classic Beetle (A4 generation). Multiple engine options from base 2.0L to turbo 1.8T and 2.5L I5. TDI diesel available. FWD. Available as hatchback or convertible. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Beetle article, January 2025 revision.

First generation midsize luxury SUV on PL71 platform. Multiple engine options from 3.2L VR6 to 5.0L V10 TDI diesel. Standard 4Motion AWD. Air suspension available. V10 TDI requires specialized diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Touareg article, January 2025 revision.

Full-size luxury sedan on D1 platform. Multiple engine options from 3.2L VR6 to 6.0L W12. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD (V8/W12). Air suspension standard. Complex luxury systems require specialized service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Phaeton article, January 2025 revision.
